mdRecord.dcterms:title: Salk Institute for Biological Studies, exterior
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Kahn, Louis Isidore (Russian-American architect and city planner, 1901-1974) [work]
Wilson, Richard Guy [photographer]
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: The institute is housed in a complex designed by the firm of Louis Kahn. Jack MacAllister, FAIA, of the Kahn firm was the supervising architect and a major design influence on the structure that consists of two symmetric buildings with a stream of water flowing in the middle travertine-paved central plaza that separates the two. -- http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Salk_Institute_for_Biological_Studies [work]
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Architecture and City Planning
research laboratories
complexes
mdRecord.dcterms:spatial: 10010 N Torrey Pines Road, La Jolla, San Diego, California, United States
